place.name: BRADLEY
place.gazetteerText: BRADLEY, a parish in Caistor district, Lincoln; 2 ½ miles SW of Great Grimsby r. station. Post Town, Grimsby. Acres, 1,523. Real property, £1,200. Pop., 108. Houses, 19. The manor belongs to Sir J. Nelthorpe, Bart. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £151.* Patron, Sir J. Nelthorpe, Bart. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)

place.name: BRADLEY HAVERSTOE
place.gazetteerText: BRADLEY-HAVERSTOE, a wapentake in the parts of Lindsey, Lincoln. It contains Bradley parish and thirty-two other parishes. Acres, 84,839. Pop., 10,771. Houses, 2,296. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
